intro: Coccocypselum gardneri, commonly known as the Gardner's coccocypselum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, ovate leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
